definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
close/familiar/intimate/closely (related)/to foster close ties/to pay close attention
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
to cut into/to incise/to penetrate deeply into (a topic, area etc)/cut (offensive moves in basketball)
to switch over/to switch modes or data streams/to cut (to a new scene)

sentences.english: Thick spears of asparagus and fennel were draped with thinly sliced ham.
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的芦笋和茴香夹在切的薄薄的火腿片里。

sentences.english: Doesn't paronychia cut fingernail to still have other treatment method?
sentences.chinese: 甲沟炎不切指甲还有别的治疗方法吗？

sentences.english: We are replacing the graph by its tangent plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们用函数的切平面来替代它的图像。

sentences.english: Just cut a small cross in the plastic at the spot you will drill.
sentences.chinese: 先在塑料板上要钻孔的地方切一个小十字。

sentences.english: Sophie:Now wash them, then dice the potatoes and bell peppers. Then slice the meat.
sentences.chinese: 现在把他们都洗干净，青椒和土豆切成丁儿，肉切片。

sentences.english: The workman had a finger cut off by the machine he was operating.
sentences.chinese: 工人被他所操作的机器切去一只手指。

sentences.english: We just peel the stickers off, cut them up, and throw them in your iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是揭掉商标然后把它们切成片丢进你的冰茶里。

sentences.english: Split the meat from bones, cut it and put in a tray.
sentences.chinese: 接着把肉从骨头上拆下来，切一下在放入一个盘子中。

sentences.english: A preliminary study on change patterns of ethylene production during flower opening and senescence in cut roses (Chinese with English Abstract).
sentences.chinese: 月季切花开花和衰老进程中乙烯变化类型初探。

sentences.english: Then she cut him half of her ten-cent cake.
sentences.chinese: 接着她把自己用十美分买的蛋糕切了一半给他。

sentences.english: And, that's the same thing --  as being tangent to the level.
sentences.chinese: 这就和“与等值面相切”说的一样了。
切土豆成叮咬大小的片断。

sentences.english: Park it on the kitchen table while you’re chopping salad.
sentences.chinese: 当你在切沙拉时把它放到厨房的桌子上。

sentences.english: Who cut off their tails with a carving knife.
sentences.chinese: 是谁用雕刻刀切了他们的尾巴。

sentences.english: Have more scruples about this and that.
sentences.chinese: 对身边白勺1切都有更多白勺顾虑。

definition: to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
(of a male) to come of age/an adult male
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
